## Pattern {.t3}

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="70%"}
![](assets/text/text/text_pattern.mp4){fig-align="center"}
:::

::: {.column width="30%"}

### Why

Restrict what can be recorded

### How

| Character | Represents |
| --------- | ---------- |
| `~`         | One alpha character (i.e., A-Z, a-z) |
| `#`         | One numeric character (i.e., 0-9) |
| `*`         | One alphanumeric character (i.e., A-z, a-z, 0-9) |


:::

::: {.notes}

###  Examples

| Pattern | Represents |
| --------- | ---------- |
| `##/##/##`  | Date |
| `0# ## ## ## ##` | [French phone number](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telephone_numbers_in_France) |
| `~~ ####` | [Flight number](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flight_number) |

:::


::::

### Household member list

- Canonical list in almost all household surveys
- One list entry per household member

### Other (specify)

Open text that follows

### Parcel list

- List to be completed before rest of parcel roster
- Sometimes unclear whether from paper instrument what the list should capture
- In this case, description and location. Are these separate questions or information that could be gathered in a list.
